thread.title: Gladiator boys, Gap girls take titles
thread.title_full: Gladiator boys, Gap girls take titles

title: Gladiator boys, Gap girls take titles
text:
Gladiator boys, Gap girls take titles Staff Report 9:53 p.m. EDT September 30, 2015 File CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
GREENVILLE â€” Riverheads' boys cross country team and Buffalo Gap girls squad posted convincing wins Wednesday in a tri-meet that included Stuart Hall. 
The Gladiator boys took five of the first six slots to easily defeat Buffalo Gap 16-46. Stuart Hall did not have enough runners for a team score. 
Meanwhile, the Bison girls likewise placed five in the top six to record a 19-43 win over the Gladiators with the Dragons placing third with 96. 
For the boys, Ethan Ernst led the Gladiators with a first-place finish in 20:07, while Ian Patterson was second in 20:43 and Derricke Hunsberger third in 21:26. Zach Hipes crossed fourth in 21:33. 
Gap's first counter was Seth Peters in 22:08 who was fifth. David Cassell was Riverheads' fifth counter, finishing sixth in 22:19. 
In the girls race, Buffalo Gap's Tiffany Simmons led the way with a first place finish in 23:57, easily outdistancing Riverheads' Kordelia Hunsberger who was second in 25:23. 
Buffalo Gap took the next four places, with Becca Wilson crossing third in 26:10 followed by Marybeth Strickler (26:17), Lexi Strange (26:29) and Hayley Stewart (26:52). 
Jodi Jones was seventh as Riverheads' second counter in 27:34. 
For Stuart Hall, Hannah Call was the top placer, placing ninth in 27:57. Read or Share this story: http://www.newsleader.com/story/sports/2015/09/30/gladiator-boys-gap-girls-take-titles-cross-country/73124728/ TOP VIDEOS
